description:
Highlights of postmarketOS 24.12 include updated interfaces with KDE Plasma Mobile 6.2.4, GNOME Shell on Mobile 46, Phosh 0.43.1, and Sxmo 1.17.0. The Phosh UI now supports accent colors, while the Sxmo UI switches to wofi as the new menu with smooth scrolling and line wrapping, and improves device support.

The post postmarketOS 24.12 Released with KDE Plasma Mobile 6.2.4, GNOME Shell 46 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: postmarketOS 24.12 Released with KDE Plasma Mobile 6.2.4, GNOME Shell 46

description:
Arch Linux users can now upgrade to the new, sleek, lightweight Xfce 4.20 desktop environment only a week after its release.

The post Xfce 4.20 Desktop Environment Landed in Arch’s Repos appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Xfce 4.20 Desktop Environment Landed in Arch’s Repos

description:
Powered by Linux kernel 6.12 LTS, Serpent OS Alpha has two official flavors featuring the latest GNOME 47.2 and COSMIC 1.0 alpha 4 desktop environments. Both editions are supported equally, but the devs recommend using the GNOME edition because the Rust-based COSMIC is not yet mature and it’s subject to frequent potentially breaking changes.

The post Serpent OS Enters Alpha with GNOME and COSMIC Spins, Powered by Linux 6.12 LTS appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Serpent OS Enters Alpha with GNOME and COSMIC Spins, Powered by Linux 6.12 LTS

description:
Darktable 5.0 open-source raw image editor has been released as a major update introducing new features, improvements, and enhanced camera support. Darktable 5.0 brings major UI/UX improvements like camera-specific styles for more than 500 camera models to more closely approximate the out-of-camera JPEG rendition.

The post Darktable 5.0 Open-Source RAW Image Editor Officially Released, Here’s What’s New appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Darktable 5.0 Open-Source RAW Image Editor Officially Released, Here’s What’s New

description:
This week was slow in Linux news and releases as we approach the Christmas and New Year’s holidays. Yet, we got major releases of the Darktable and OpenShot applications, and new ISO snapshots of the CachyOS, Fedora Asahi Remix, Grml, IPFire, Kali Linux, and PorteuX distributions.

The post 9to5Linux Weekly Roundup: December 22nd, 2024 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 9to5Linux Weekly Roundup: December 22nd, 2024

description:
If you’re looking to start a Next.js project on your Ubuntu-based systems, this guide will walk you through the process step-by-step.

The post How to Install and Set Up a New Next.js Project on Ubuntu appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install and Set Up a New Next.js Project on Ubuntu

description:
Highlights of OpenShot 3.3 include Cosmic Dusk as the default theme for a modern and stylish look, a Wayland-compatible color picker that allows color picking only from the OpenShot main window, customizable audio buffer size in preferences for optimal playback, and a Recovery menu for recovering previous auto-saved files.

The post OpenShot 3.3 Open-Source Video Editor Is Now Available, Here’s What’s New appeared first on Linux Today.
title: OpenShot 3.3 Open-Source Video Editor Is Now Available, Here’s What’s New

description:
Google’s open-source tool Vanir enables Android developers to quickly scan custom platform code for missing or applicable security patches. By automating patch validation, Vanir helps OEMs deliver critical security updates faster, enhancing the security of the Android ecosystem.

The post Vanir: Open-Source Security Patch Validation for Android appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Vanir: Open-Source Security Patch Validation for Android

description:
YQPkg is a new Qt-based GUI package management tool for openSUSE, an alternative to YaST, offering intuitive updates, installs, and dependency management.

The post openSUSE Unveils YQPkg, a Standalone GUI Package Management Tool appeared first on Linux Today.
title: openSUSE Unveils YQPkg, a Standalone GUI Package Management Tool

description:
Powered by the latest and greatest Linux 6.12 LTS kernel series, the CachyOS release for December 2024 enables AutoFDO (Automatic Feedback-Directed Optimization) for the default linux-cachyos kernel on all supported architectures for a slight performance boost.

The post CachyOS Now Uses AutoFDO Kernel as Default Across All Supported Architectures appeared first on Linux Today.
title: CachyOS Now Uses AutoFDO Kernel as Default Across All Supported Architectures

description:
Grml, a live bootable Linux distro based on Debian GNU/Linux and designed for system administrators and users of text tools, has been updated to version 2024.12, a release that extends hardware support and brings updated components.

The post Debian-Based Grml 2024.12 Linux Distro Is Out with Support for 64-Bit ARM CPUs appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Debian-Based Grml 2024.12 Linux Distro Is Out with Support for 64-Bit ARM CPUs

description:
The main objective of a VDR is to prevent unauthorized access to critical documents and data while keeping them always accessible to authorized users.

The post Top 3 Open Source Virtual Data Room (VDR) for Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Top 3 Open Source Virtual Data Room (VDR) for Linux

description:
In this step-by-step guide, we will explain how to create an audiobook from a text file using a Python script called Audiogenipy in Linux.

The post Audiogenipy: Create Audiobooks With Python And gTTS Effortlessly In Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Audiogenipy: Create Audiobooks With Python And gTTS Effortlessly In Linux

description:
Discover COBOL (Common Business-Oriented Language) features, installation steps, and a tutorial for writing and executing your first COBOL program on a Linux system.

The post COBOL Programming on Linux: Installation Guide & First Program appeared first on Linux Today.
title: COBOL Programming on Linux: Installation Guide & First Program

description:
Learn how to run a Linux command or shell script from a Python script, then get the execution status code or save the output to a Python variable.

The post How to Execute Linux Command From Python Script appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Execute Linux Command From Python Script
